title: 1 triangle and 2 squareS
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/7a9251afe1.2ac5cc9c0f.WVQtJl.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"\nIN THE GIVEN PROBLEM, TRIANGLE IS OF SIDE LENGTH=8 UNITS AND EQUILATERAL AND TWO SQUARES ARE INSCRIBED IN THE TRIANGLE AS SHOWN.FIND THE LENGTH OF THE SQUARE UP TO 3 DECIMAL PLACES."}]}]}

title: 1 Trillion Followers Problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \begin{cases}{\sin(2x) + \sin(2y) = 1/3} \\ {\cos(2x) + \cos(2y) = 5/7}\end{cases} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Given "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfy the system of equations above, and denote the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan(x) + \tan(y) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for coprime positive integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Bonus","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":": For the general system of equations below, state "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan(x) + \tan(y) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in terms of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \begin{cases}{\sin(2x) + \sin(2y) = A} \\ {\cos(2x) + \cos(2y) = B}\end{cases} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I'm going straight for the generalization."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \tan x + \tan y &=&\frac{\sin x }{\cos x} + \frac{ \sin y}{\cos y} \\ & = & \frac { \sin x \cos y + \cos x \sin y}{\cos x  \cos y} \\
& = & \frac{2 \sin(x+y)}{2\cos x \cos y} \\
& = & \color{#3D99F6}{\frac{2 \sin(x+y)}{\cos(x+y) + \cos(x-y)} }\\ \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the first equation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \sin(2x) + \sin(2y) & = & A \\
2 \sin(x+  y) \cos(x-y) & = & A \\
\color{#20A900}{ \sin(x+  y)} & = & \color{#20A900}{\frac A2 \sec(x-y)} \\ \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the second equation:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \cos(2x) + \cos(2y) & = & B \\
2 \cos(x+  y) \cos(x-y) & = & B \\
\color{#69047E}{ \cos(x+  y)} & = & \color{#69047E}{\frac B2 \sec(x-y)} \\ \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \color{#20A900}{GREEN} ^2 + \color{#69047E}{PURPLE} ^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned}
\sin^2(x+  y) + \cos^2(x+y) &=& \left ( \frac {A^2}{4} +  \frac {B^2}{4} \right) \sec^2 (x-y) \\
1 &=& \frac 14 (A^2+B^2) \sec^2 (x-y) \\
\cos(x-y) &=& \pm \frac{\sqrt{A^2+B^2}}{2} \\ \end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solve for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \color{#20A900}{GREEN} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \color{#69047E}{PURPLE} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sin(x+y) = \pm \frac A{\sqrt{A^2+B^2}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \cos(x+y) = \pm \frac B{\sqrt{A^2+B^2}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"When taking their ratios as in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \color{#3D99F6}{BLUE} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the signs "match up" and cancel out."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \tan x + \tan y  =  \frac{2 \cdot \frac A{\sqrt{A^2+B^2}} } { \frac B{\sqrt{A^2+B^2}} + \frac{\sqrt{A^2+B^2}}2 }  =  \frac{4A}{2B + A^2+B^2} \\  "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In this case, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A = \frac 13, B = \frac57 \Rightarrow \tan x + \tan y = \frac{147}{226} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Solved it twice, first using "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Abhishek Sharma"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/abhishek-i2fria/"}]},{"type":"text","text":"'s method and then same as yours! Nice problem.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\huge \text{1 Trillion Followers Problem}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You are quite ambitious . Well , all the best for achieving that target . I know that this is the preview question by you , so I'll be waiting for the real deal ."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \huge \text{＼(^o^)／}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/ClENdbMelT-dsc00505.JPG?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can interpret the given equations as the addition of unit vectors, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\cos{2x},\sin{2x})+(\cos{2y},\sin{2y})=\left(\frac{5}{7},\frac{1}{3}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". See the attached figure, where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r=\sqrt{A^2+B^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can find the points "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\cos{2x},\sin{2x})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\cos{2y},\sin{2y})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as the two points of intersection of the unit circles centered at the origin and at the point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A,B)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". These points turn out to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}(A,B)\pm\frac{\sqrt{1-r^2/4}}{r}(B,-A)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"; this result should make good sense in terms of our figure. Now "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{x}+\tan{y}=\frac{1-\cos{2x}}{\sin{2x}}+\frac{1-\cos{2y}}{\sin{2y}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here is an ALTERNATIVE SOLUTION, more in line with the two others, but from a vectorial point of view (or just think in terms of polar coordinates!), supported by the attached figure. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r=\sqrt{A^2+B^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and note that the polar angle of the point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A,B)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x+y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (we may have to change the angle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which will not affect the problem). Now "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos(x+y)=\frac{B}{r},\quad\sin(x+y)=\frac{A}{r},\quad\cos(y-x)=\frac{r}{2},"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{x}+\tan{y}=\frac{2\sin(x+y)}{\cos(x+y)+\cos(y-x)}=\frac{2A/r}{B/r+r/2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{4A}{2B+r^2}=\frac{4A}{2B+A^2+B^2}=\boxed{\frac{147}{226}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Conceptually, my first solution is very simple... but the devil is in the detail, the computation. The points "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\cos{2x},\sin{2x})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(\cos{2y},\sin{2y})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" have a distance of 1 from the origin as well as from the point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(A,B)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so, they are the points of intersections of those two circles I defined. Problem is, the coordinates come out messy, involving "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{102065}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".      "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I didn't catch the typo... sorry...it's late.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin {2x} + \sin{2y}=A"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2\sin{\left( x+y \right) }\sin{\left( x-y \right)=A \quad \dots 1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos {2x} + \cos{2y}=B"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2\cos{\left( x+y \right) }\cos{\left( x-y \right) }=B \quad \dots 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Dividing equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{\left( x+y \right)=\frac{A}{B}} \dots 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{\left( x+y \right)}=\frac{\tan{x}+\tan{y}}{1-\tan{x} \tan{y}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{x}+\tan{y}=\tan{\left( x+y \right)}\left(1-\tan{x} \tan{y}\right) \quad \dots 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{x} \tan{y}=\frac{\sin{x}\sin{y}}{\cos{x}\cos{y}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{2\sin{x}\sin{y}}{2\cos{x}\cos{y}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{\cos{\left( x-y \right) }-\cos{\left( x+y \right) }}{\cos{\left( x+y \right) }-\cos{\left( x-y \right) }} \quad \dots 5"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Squaring and adding "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4\cos ^{ 2 }{ \left( x-y \right) ={ A }^{ 2 }+{ B }^{ 2 } } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos { \left( x-y \right)  } =\quad \frac { \sqrt { { A }^{ 2 }+{ B }^{ 2 } }  }{ 2 } \quad \dots 6"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Using equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we have,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos { \left( x+y \right)  } =\quad \frac { B }{ \sqrt { { A }^{ 2 }+{ B }^{ 2 } }  } \quad \dots 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Using equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we get,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan { x } \tan { y } =\frac { { A }^{ 2 }+{ B }^{ 2 }-2B }{ { A }^{ 2 }+{ B }^{ 2 }+2B } \quad \dots 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Using equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{x}+\tan{y}=\frac { 4A }{ { A }^{ 2 }+{ B }^{ 2 }+2B } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \boxed{\frac{147}{226}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
